text: So, this is the new "disruptive" business model, huh? Doing nothing and getting rich. Genius!
I wish I had thought of that when I started my own startup. Would have saved me a ton of time and effort!
Yeah, but how do they actually make money? Is it just by generating hype and securing investments?
My guess is that they're selling their "doing nothing" methodology to other companies. The less you do, the less you can screw up, am I right?
I heard they were going to IPO soon. I'm going to put my life savings into it. YOLO!
Are you serious? That sounds like a terrible idea...
Of course I'm not serious! I was being sarcastic. Although with the way the market works these days, who knows, maybe it would be a good investment!
They're obviously onto something. This is the natural progression of minimalist companies. First, it was "do one thing and do it well." Now, it's "do nothing and do it perfectly."
And the next step will be "do less than nothing and excel at it." Can't wait to see what that looks like!
Maybe we'll finally discover the secret to creating perpetual motion machines by doing less than nothing!
I bet their burn rate is exceptionally low. Investors must love that!
But what's the return on investment? Even if the burn rate is low, if there's no product or service, there can't be any revenue.
They're probably just selling "nothing" as a service. NaaS: the future of tech!
NaaS? That's hilarious! But you might be onto something. I can see a market for it. Imagine selling nothing to the government. They'd pay millions for that.
